micro_stories: Someone took your toy without asking
You had to stop playing when you weren't ready
Someone said something that hurt your feelings
Things didn't go the way you wanted
You heard a loud noise you didn't expect
You're worried about something new happening
You're in a place that feels unfamiliar
You had a scary thought or dream
Something you were excited about didn't happen
You feel lonely or left out
Something you care about got lost or broken
You want to feel even more peaceful
You're getting ready for a quiet activity
You want to relax before bedtime
You just want to feel good in your body
calm.self_entry_prompt: What are you doing right now?

scripts.name: Calm Breathing
scripts.description: Breathe slowly to help your body calm down

steps.text: Let's do some calm breathing together. Put your hands on your belly
Breathe in slowly through your nose... 1... 2... 3...
Now breathe out through your mouth... 1... 2... 3... 4...
Breathe in again... 1... 2... 3...
One more time. In... 1... 2... 3...
Notice how your belly moves up and down like gentle waves
Keep breathing slowly. You're helping your body feel calmer
Nice work! You did calm breathing

scripts.reflection_prompt: How does your body feel now after breathing slowly?
scripts.repeat_offer: Would you like to do more breathing?

scripts.name: Wall Push
scripts.description: Push against a wall to use your strong muscles

steps.text: When you feel angry, using your strong muscles can help! Let's try it
Find a wall and put both hands on it, like you're going to push it down
Now push as HARD as you can! Use all your strength! 1... 2... 3... 4... 5!
Stop and shake out your arms. Let them feel loose and wiggly
Take a deep breath in... and let it out
Ready for another push? Hands on the wall!
PUSH! Even harder this time! 1... 2... 3... 4... 5!
Shake it out again. Feel your arms relax
One more big breath in... and out
Awesome job! You used your strong muscles to help with big feelings

scripts.reflection_prompt: Do you feel less angry now?
scripts.repeat_offer: Want to do more wall pushes?

scripts.name: Look Around
scripts.description: Notice things around you to feel more present

steps.text: When we feel scared, noticing what's around us can help us feel safer. Let's try it
First, look around the room. Find 3 things you can see
What colors are they? What shapes? Really look at them
Now, reach out and touch 2 things near you
Are they soft or hard? Smooth or bumpy? Warm or cool?
Close your eyes for a moment and listen carefully
What's 1 sound you can hear? Maybe it's quiet, maybe it's loud
Open your eyes. Take a deep breath in... and out
You're right here, right now. You're safe in this moment
Great job noticing! You helped yourself feel more calm and safe

scripts.reflection_prompt: Do you feel more calm and safe now?
scripts.repeat_offer: Want to notice more things around you?

scripts.name: Easy Stretch
scripts.description: Simple stretches to help your body feel better

steps.text: Let's wake up your body with some gentle stretches
Stand up if you can, and reach your arms way up high to the sky!
Stretch as tall as you can! Like you're trying to touch the clouds
Now slowly drop your arms down and let them hang loose, like noodles
Gently roll your shoulders back... and around... nice and slow
Now shake out your whole body! Shake your arms, legs, wiggle around!
Reach up high one more time! Stretch!
And relax. Let your body feel loose and comfortable
Take a deep breath in... and let it all out with a big sigh
Wonderful! Your body feels better after moving and stretching

scripts.reflection_prompt: How does your body feel after stretching?
scripts.repeat_offer: Would you like to stretch more?

scripts.name: Count and Breathe
scripts.description: Slow counting with breaths to calm down

steps.text: Counting slowly can help calm down big angry feelings. Let's try it together
Take a breath, then say 1
Breathe... then 2
Breathe... then 3
Breathe... then 4
Breathe... then 5
You're doing great. Keep going slowly
Breathe... then 6
Breathe... then 7
Breathe... then 8
Breathe... then 9
Breathe... and 10!
Take one more big, slow breath in... and out
Excellent! You counted all the way to 10. You helped yourself calm down

scripts.name: Squeeze and Let Go
scripts.description: Tense and relax your muscles to release tension

steps.text: This exercise helps let go of tight, uncomfortable feelings in your body
Make tight fists with both hands. Squeeze them as hard as you can!
Hold it... squeeze... notice how it feels
Now let go! Open your hands and relax them completely
Feel the difference? That's what relaxed feels like
Now squeeze your shoulders up to your ears! Scrunch them up tight!
Hold it... feel the squeeze...
And let them drop! Let your shoulders relax down
Take a nice slow breath in... and let it all out
Great work! You helped your body let go of tension

scripts.reflection_prompt: Does your body feel more relaxed?
scripts.repeat_offer: Want to squeeze and relax more?

scripts.name: Imagine Your Safe Place
scripts.description: Picture a calm, safe place in your mind

steps.text: Let's imagine a place where you feel really safe and happy
Close your eyes if that feels okay, or just look down
Think of a place you love. Maybe it's your room, or outside, or somewhere special
What do you see there? What colors? What things?
What sounds would you hear in your safe place?
How does it feel? Is it warm or cool? Cozy?
Who else is there? Maybe someone you love, or a pet, or just you
Take a slow breath and feel how safe and calm this place is
You can come back to this place in your mind whenever you need to
When you're ready, open your eyes. You did a great job imagining!

scripts.reflection_prompt: What was your safe place like?
scripts.repeat_offer: Would you like to imagine your safe place again?

scripts.name: Color Breathing
scripts.description: Breathe in calm colors and breathe out worried feelings

steps.text: Let's use our imagination and breathing together
Think of a color that makes you feel calm and happy. Maybe blue, or green, or purple
Breathe in slowly, and imagine breathing in that calm color
See it filling up your body with calm, peaceful feelings
Now breathe out slowly. As you breathe out, imagine breathing out gray or dark colors
You're breathing out the worried or angry or sad feelings
Breathe in your calm color again... filling up with peace
And breathe out the uncomfortable feelings... letting them go
One more time. In with calm color... out with dark feelings
Beautiful! You used your imagination and breathing to help yourself feel better

scripts.reflection_prompt: What color did you choose? How do you feel now?
scripts.repeat_offer: Want to do more color breathing?

scripts.name: Jump and Wiggle
scripts.description: Move your body to shake off big feelings

steps.text: Sometimes moving your body really helps with big feelings. Let's try it!
If you can, stand up and give yourself some space
Start by jumping up and down! Jump! Jump! Jump!
Keep jumping! Let all that energy out!
Now stop and shake your whole body! Wiggle everything!
Shake your arms! Shake your legs! Wiggle your head!
Jump some more! Get all that feeling out of your body!
And... stop! Stand still for a moment
Take a big breath in... and let it all out with a big sigh
Awesome job! You moved that feeling through your body!

scripts.reflection_prompt: Do you feel different after moving around?
scripts.repeat_offer: Want to jump and wiggle more?

angry.context_intro: When you feel angry, your body has lots of energy. Let's use that energy in a helpful way!
angry.choice_prompt: Which would help you most right now?

options.display_name: Push the wall with my strong muscles

scared.context_intro: When you feel scared, let's help you feel safe and calm again.

sad.context_intro: When you feel sad, let's do something gentle to help you feel a little better.
sad.choice_prompt: What would feel good to try?

calm.context_intro: You're feeling calm! Let's do something peaceful to feel even better.
